thread.title: Celebrate Celtic Culture at Clans on the CoastTravelandtourworld.com
thread.title_full: Celebrate Celtic Culture at Clans on the CoastTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Celebrate Celtic Culture at Clans on the CoastTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Celebrate Celtic Culture at Clans on the Coast Published on : Tuesday, September 8, 2015
Highland dancing, caber toss, bagpipe bands and medieval battle re-enactments are just some of the festivities that will take place as part of Port Stephens’ annual Celtic Festival, Clans on the Coast.
To be held on Saturday, September 19, 2015, the event encourages locals and travellers alike to join as Tomaree Sports Ground at Nelson Bay comes alive with market stalls, singing groups, highland games and even a fashion parade – for dogs dressed as Scotsmen.
A not-for-profit event run by local volunteers, Clans on the Coast was started by local Ron Swan, who wanted to create an annual festival celebrating and sharing the Scottish and Celtic settlers’ historic contribution to Australia.
Celtic jewellery, DVDs, clothing, haggis and other food, wine and beer tastings will be on offer at the many market stalls, alongside clan tents, where visitors can make connections with their ancestry clans. Displays will include a marching parade at 9.30am, Scottish pipe bands, Celtic dancing, medieval fighting and a series of amateur events where men and women compete in tug-of-war, light caber toss and a push up contest, in order to win the coveted ‘strongman’ and ‘strongwoman’ trophies. The event will finish with a massed band finale.
Activities for children will also be on offer, provided by Raymond Terrace Scouts.
Clans on the Coast will be held on Saturday, September 19, 2015, from 8.30am to 4.30pm. Tickets cost $15 for adults, $10 for pensioners, and children under 18 are free.
